Text: Sports betting - Russia to reconsider its attitude
to competitions We can say that the admission
of Russian athletes to international competitions
has been taking place for years. He knows this,
in fact. But what is happening now is a reason
to reconsider the attitude towards big sport on
a national scale. We are accustomed to the system
of relations, sport is an expensive, prestigious
toy on the world stage: we went out, won medals,
glorified the Fatherland. Now, it is easy to see,
the question of prestige has been replaced by
efforts to avoid humiliation once again: come,
pee in a jar 30 times, sign a piece of paper in
20 places, support the Kremlin as a dissident
Youth Sports School - they will allow you to speak.
Just need a neutral flag, for sure. Do you need
this? Probably not. Should we? First, look at
the leading American leagues. Hockey fans need
to be explained: every Winter Olympics, international
sports officials run around the NHL, hoping that
the National Hockey League clubs will still allow
players to compete in the Games. And they meet
halfway: the championship is more important. And
why? Yes, the League is popular, the League is
profitable, the League is more important than
American spectators, the Olympics. We have to
achieve it. But we will have to reconsider the
attitude towards sports as such. To make it a
mass affair. Everyone knows the movie phrase,
‚Äúcaptain of the school baseball team.‚Äù Do schools
in Russia have teams? In a sport? Our sport operates
as a factory for the production of achievements,
the pyramid stands on its head: the most promising
juniors rise like rockets, the majority of children
do nothing. Then adults grow up and study. In
addition, suboptimal decisions lead to the fact
that attendance at professional competitions is
falling; going to a t-shirt is an atypical entertainment.
As a result, sports generate profits and look
for sponsors everywhere. Moreover, the salaries
of athletes are absurdly huge. The whole pyramid
needs to be put on its head. Sports are primarily
school and student sports. A professional earns
money - a toy of tycoons, a serious business.
The goal is to perform well in international competitions;
someday they'll call. The goal is Tver, Chelyabinsk,
Kerch, Lugansk, and local competitions with full
stands. Yes, you will like it; The measures will
be appreciated by blockheads (and managers), who
are accustomed to defeating Zanzibar teams with
a score of 1:0. Reality will have to return. But
sport is the business of a narrow group of millionaires.
This is a people's business. And since we were
kicked out, let‚Äôs look for sources of strength
in our own country.

Text: The United States accused North Korea of ‚Äã‚Äãsupplying

Text: Putin obliged exporters to sell foreign currency
earnings‚Äîthe ruble strengthened sharply. How long
will this last? Perhaps they want to allow at
least a new collapse in the presidential elections
in March 2024. Russian President Vladimir Putin
signed a decree on the mandatory sale of foreign
currency earnings. The decision was made; the
dollar consolidated above 100 rubles and updated
the anti-record for 2023 - 102 rubles on the Moscow
Exchange.‚úπ Putin‚Äôs decree helped the dollar rate
retreat above 100 rubles; further strengthening
of the Russian currency depends on many factors.
In particular, the market will understand that
the authorities will force the sale of foreign
currency earnings: an open list of exporters,
the president‚Äôs decision is being circulated,
for the public to see (the Kremlin explains the
secrecy with the threat of sanctions). ‚úπ In addition,
the Central Bank openly doubted whether the effect
of the sale of currency by large companies would
be tangible: the head of the regulator, Elvira
Nabiullina, insisted that business was making
it possible to support the ruble (however, the
chairman of the Central Bank expressed disagreement
with the president‚Äôs decision). ‚úπ Otherwise, analysts
agree that the new measure will lower the dollar
range to 90‚Äì95 rubles. Some suggest that the authorities
need a stronger ruble ahead of the 2024 presidential
elections. It is difficult to predict what they
are: in any case, a strong national currency is
a definite positive factor for the Russian budget.
Let's understand, it is important to know the
decree on the sale of foreign currency earnings
by exporters.

be recognized as illegitimate, Russia as a dictatorship.

power of Vladimir Putin, who rules the country
as President and Prime Minister in 2000, has turned

‚Äúrepresent a threat to international peace, security,

annexation of Crimea, the war in Donbass, and
the crash of flight MH17.

Text: With a billion Catholics in the world, disagreements
are growing. Pope Francis has a plan to overcome
the schism. Is it possible to implement it? Even
the name Francis, chosen by the pontiff, is deeply
symbolic. This name (like, for example, Jesus
Peter) was used as the name of the popes. In the
Catholic tradition, first of all, the sad state
of the Church is symbolized by the readiness for
revival. These are the challenges faced by the
current pope (the refusal to ordain women priests
is the attitude of the Church to LGBTQ couples
- the only ones):‚úπ There are deep differences
in the Church's ideas about the necessary reforms
of people in different parts of the world. Each
country, region, continent has requirements and
a special way of perceiving theological concepts.‚úπ
Today believers are leaving the Church en masse.

6.6 million people in ten years, 2011-2021.‚úπ The
current model of the Church involves the division
of believers, teaching clergy, obediently listening,
voting laity, lack of communication between them.
Pope Francis has set an ambitious task - to teach
the clergy of the laity to listen to each other.
Francis is trying to achieve results using different
methods: for example, during the current Synod,
the usual rows of chairs and many round tables
were installed in the Assembly Hall of Paul VI.
When preparing for the event, the pope tried to
find out the opinion of absolutely every believer
on the reforms. Participants in the discussion
learn to dialogue, ‚Äúwelcoming everyone, excluding
no one.‚Äù At the request of the cooperative of
independent journalists ‚ÄúBereg‚Äù, candidate of
historical sciences, specialist in the history
of Catholicism Boris Filippov spoke about the

to be revolutionary in the Roman Catholic Church.

Filippov‚Äôs text in full.

Text: The Israel Defense Forces used white phosphorus
ammunition in Gaza Lebanon, says Human Rights
Watch. Human rights activists report with a link
to verified video recordings of the use of ammunition
on October 10-11. The recordings show numerous
flashes of white phosphorus fired from artillery
shells from the Gaza port city of two communities
on Israel's border with Lebanon, Human Rights
Watch (HRW) said. White phosphorus can cause severe
burns and cause long-term harm to human health.
It is considered a chemical weapon and operates
primarily through the heat of the flame and toxicity,
HRW notes. White phosphorus is used as an incendiary
weapon, creating a smoke screen, masking troop
movements, and interfering with infrared optics.
The IDF used white phosphorus shells during Operation
Cast Lead in 2008-2009. Then the Israeli Foreign
Ministry reported that smoke screens were used,
HRW notes that human rights activists documented
the victims of civilians in the Gaza Strip. After
2013, the Israeli military told the country's
Supreme Court to use white phosphorus in populated
areas except in "two narrow situations," judges
were told.

Text: The Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe
recognized the Holodomor as genocide of the Ukrainian
people. The Parliamentary Assembly of the Council
of Europe called on the parliaments of the PACE
member states to adopt resolutions recognizing
the Holodomor as genocide. President of Ukraine
Vladimir Zelensky thanked PACE for the decision.
The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine declared the Holodomor
an act of genocide of the Ukrainian people in
2006. The Ukrainian authorities have been seeking
for years the official recognition of the Holodomor
as genocide; against the backdrop of a full-scale
war, the country supported the decision. In 2022,
the assessment was given by Germany's European
Parliament, in 2023 by Bulgaria, Belgium, Great
Britain, France and Iceland.

Text: üáÆüá±üáµüá∏What is Israel's ground operation in the Gaza
Strip: analysis of the Military Chronicle. Part
1 If the Israeli leadership decides on a ground
operation, the IDF will have to choose a bad bad
scenario. Will there be a ground operation? Large-scale
ground operation - possible scenarios, fact, he
was chosen. Perhaps the Israeli leadership will
choose the radical option of establishing a complete
blockade of the enclave through private operations
to destroy identified Hamas militants and release
hostages. Why is a ground operation needed? It
requires physical control of the territory of
the Palestinian enclave; it is impossible to destroy
the manpower of the infrastructure of the Hamas
movement. It is impossible to carry out the tasks
of the presence of ground forces ‚Äúon the ground‚Äù.
But deciding on a large-scale ground operation
is not easy for a number of reasons. Which ones?
Firstly, Israel will have to fight a super-urbanized
area of ‚Äã‚Äã365 square meters. km, 2 million people
live in dense urban areas. Such an environment
minimizes the advantages of IDF intelligence,
aviation and heavy equipment. Secondly, a series
of airstrikes by the Israeli Air Force in Gaza,
a significant number of residents are ready to
join the ranks of Hamas. In fact, Islamists sit
in a huge motivated mobilization reserve. According
to various estimates, 250 thousand 600 thousand
Palestinians of different ages will take weapons
from Gaza. Thirdly, the IDF forces, despite the
concentration of forces, faced active opposition
from armed groups. Apparently, the mobilization
of 320 thousand people was required by Israel
to respond to possible attempts at external intervention,
taking into account the potential involvement
of the conflict by Hezbollah, the IRGC, Muslim
volunteers from neighboring countries - Jordan,
Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Syria and Iraq. In the event
of the arrival of additional troops, the weapons
of the countries fighting on the Palestinian side
will have enough of the current level of mobilization
for Israel. Fourth, the death of high-ranking
officers of the Golani and Nahal ground brigades,
along with personnel, showed that Israel is partially
ready for large-scale urban battles. The training
of reservists of the regular forces is uneven;
the units are ready for active combat operations.
This is evidenced, for example, by repeated cases
of ‚Äúfriendly fire‚Äù by parts of the Israeli security
forces, which have been recorded in recent days.
With time for additional training, there is no
combat coordination of the mobilized Israeli army.
To lead? The ground battle of Gaza is neither
simple nor quick. Everyone understands this, Tel
Aviv. The operation will require Israel to attract
significant resources - human, material and political.
In addition, the ground operation is, in general,
extremely bloody. It is difficult to predict the
level of losses; the experience of the battles
of the US Army Mosul and the Syrian army Aleppo
allows us to assume that we are talking about
tens of thousands of killed and wounded. However,
it should be emphasized that Israel is historically
more sensitive to losses than its opponents. There
is a possibility that a protracted operation combined
with high losses will negatively affect public
political support.üìù What is Israel's ground operation
in the Gaza Strip: analysis of the Military Chronicle.

Text: The executive committee of the CIS had to solve
the alphabetical-political puzzle by awarding
the President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev
with an honorary badge. Initially, the CIS Badge
of Honor is a chain of flags of the member states
of the commonwealth - in alphabetical order: Azerbaijan,
Armenia, Belarus, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan,
Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan,
Ukraine (pictured 2 - sample of 2004). And the
twelve-pointed star is the symbolism of the CIS.
The last time the sign was presented to Armenian
President Robert Kocharyan was in 2008, it has
changed... As a source of delegations told SHOT,
Georgia was removed due to the exit of the CIS,
Moldova was left in Ukraine, they are legally
part of the unification. True, a reshuffle had
to be made: Ukraine was moved away, it takes an
active part in the life of the CIS, and the flag
turned out to be Russian when it was moved. Then
it was decided to neglect the alphabetical sequence
to ‚Äúbreak‚Äù Ukraine and Russia into two members
- Tajikistan and Turkmenistan. And to maintain
symmetry, they placed the CIS flag in place of
the Ukrainian flag, duplicating the image of the
star. According to SHOT‚Äôs interlocutor, Alexander
Lukashenko approached Mirziyoyev‚Äôs award ceremony
and actively showed the flag of Ukraine to a series
of flags in the chain. What the Belarusian president
explained to his Uzbek counterpart is known. üéØ

Text: From the book ‚Äú500 days of defeats and victories‚Äù‚Äî
Guys, get up! Missile danger! ‚Äî for the third
time at night, the political officer runs into
the tent. Our camp is located in the Chernobyl
exclusion zone, the ‚ÄúDityatki‚Äù checkpoint. I passed
through in 2006, preparing a series of reports
on the 20th anniversary of the Chernobyl nuclear
power plant accident, and lived in Pripyat. Now
there is a supply route for the group, starting
in Belarus and running through the fourth power
unit of the cooling ponds. The tent is huge, the
potbelly stove is ‚Äúfor children.‚Äù As soon as you
have time to warm up in your sleeping bag, the
officer wakes you up, and we run 500 meters into
the bivouac road at night. The alert reports the
launch of an enemy tactical missile, saying it

Text: BRIEF. In the moment. The governor of the Murmansk
region, Chibis, initiated a highly controversial
project for the development of support centers
in the Arctic zone. As political scientist Grashchenkov
writes, according to Chibis‚Äôs plan, the cities
of the Arctic are competitors to Moscow and the
administrative centers of the Middle Zone; otherwise,
people are leaving. In order to improve the quality
of life, a whole range of measures is required:
renovation of urban, social and cultural infrastructure,
creation of advanced educational institutions
focused on the Arctic labor market. The topic
of the Arctic territories is new. Back in the
Soviet Union, there were serious discussions about
the feasibility of developing the Far North. Most
economists and medical sociologists are extremely
skeptical about the idea of ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãdeveloping a network
of cities in the Far North. The costs are huge,
labor resources are in demand locally at resource-extracting
enterprises; living conditions are critically
negative - high morbidity and mortality. The general
consensus of the 2000s was to take the experience
of Canada and Finland - reduce the number of residents,
transport pensioners to the continent, work in
small territorial agglomerations. Governor Chibis
calls for the return of the great Soviet construction
projects to develop the North, literally burning
billions of public money in the furnace. The governor‚Äôs
cunning is that the federal budget bill wants
to trivially reconstruct the territories where
the assets of Norilsk Nickel and Novatek corporations
are located. Unfortunately, socially responsible
business has brought cities to complete ruin.
During Chibis's management of the Murmansk region,
there has been a steady outflow of residents and
a decrease in the birth rate. The last thing left
is to fill the problem with budget money.

scientists tested a model trained on the basis

prosecution. With politics? Technology, in particular,
aids political persecution. A typical example
is facial recognition during protests. The use
of an appropriate system makes it possible to
scale up physical control by political rivals
and increases the risks of protesters. In fact,
facial recognition leaves protesters with a chance
to leave the rally unnoticed, which is likely
to have a negative impact on the large scale of
the event. Pavel Ivanov

Text: The Yekaterinburg City Duma elected a chairman
at an extraordinary meeting. This post was occupied
for the first time by a woman - United Russia
deputy Anna Gurariy. The meeting of the Duma took
place on October 13, 2023. Before the meeting
of the United Russia faction took place, Gurary
was officially nominated for the position of speaker.
No alternative candidates were submitted to the
faction; Gurary was elected as chairman of the
Duma by unanimous vote. The meeting was attended
by the Vice-Governor of the Sverdlovsk Region
Oleg Chemezov. Anna Gurariy is 33 years old and
heads the Department of Political Science and
Sociology at UrFU. She was first elected to the
City Duma in the September 2023 elections. Her
husband Evgeny Gurariy works as an assistant to
the plenipotentiary representative of the President
of the Urals Federal District.

Text: A meeting of the Council of Heads of State of

website. In particular, at the summit an agreement
was signed on the establishment of the International

statements were signed - international relations
in a multipolar world, cooperation in the field
of digitalization of public administration, protection
of the citizen‚Äôs human rights, freedom of religion,
support for the promotion of the Russian language
as the language of interethnic communication.

in 2024 (this post will go to Kyrgyzstan Russia),
holding the next meeting (it is scheduled for
October 8, 2024 in Moscow), the decision to declare
Samarkand the cultural capital of the Commonwealth
in 2024. Separate items on the list include the
decision to award the President of Uzbekistan
Shavkat Mirziyoyev with the honorary badge of
the CIS and to establish the medal ‚ÄúFor Contribution
to Strengthening Peace.‚Äù

Text: During the war in Ukraine, fragments of UAV missiles
were found in neighboring countries 20 times.
During the Russian invasion of Ukraine, fragments
of UAV missiles were found at least 21 times in
the territories of six nearby European states,
Vorstka counted. More often, missiles flew into
the territory of Moldova, including the unrecognized
Transnistria. The country's authorities reported
the first case on October 31, 2022. The wreckage
of a Russian shell shot down by Ukrainian air
defense was found in the village of Naslavcha,
separated from Ukraine by the Dniester River.
Since then, Moldovan authorities have reported
the found wreckage six times. On February 10,
the Ministry of Defense of Moldova confirmed that
a Russian missile entered the country‚Äôs airspace.
Six times drone missiles found Romanian territory.
On May 11, 2022, the Ukrainian ‚ÄúBayraktar‚Äù was
caught in the territorial waters of the Sulina
Sfyntu-Gheorghe area. On September 26, 2023, as
a result of Russian shelling, the Orlovka ferry
checkpoint on the Ukrainian-Romanian border was
damaged. Missile debris was found in Poland twice.
On November 15, near the village of Pshevoduv,
on the border with Ukraine, a rocket explosion
killed two people. According to the National Prosecutor's
Office of Poland, the missile was launched into
Ukraine. On the day Russia carried out massive
shelling of Ukraine, Ukrainian air defense missiles
were launched in pairs to increase their effectiveness.
One explosion for an unknown reason fell in Poland.
The second time a rocket was found on April 25
in the city of Bydgoszcz, once a Russian one.
Three times the wreckage was found in Bulgaria,
two times in Belarus. In July, a fragment of a
Russian anti-aircraft missile system ‚ÄúPantsir-S1‚Äù
was found on the coast of Bulgaria in the towns
of Pomorie Aheloy. One Soviet reconnaissance drone
Tu-141 ‚ÄúStrizh‚Äù fell in Croatian Zagreb in March
of this year. A faulty UAV, having flown over

Text: DONBASS JIHAD The other day a comrade (a first-wave
militiaman, a historian, a Eurasianist) stopped
by and talked about the complex dialectical relationship
between Russia and the Donbass. Russia is a whole,
Donbass is part of the whole. But dialectics is
part of the whole. It's more difficult here. Donbass
is a frontier, with a special ethical ontology,
Russia is a huge state-civilization, individual
parts of which may feel that the state is waging
war. Between the greater Russia and Donbass there
is a huge everyday gap (that is, a difference
in everyday life), an existential gap. A friend
has already compared Donbass to the planet Arakis
in the Dune universe of Frank Herbert. Residents
of Donbass, outlying Russians - Fremen, Feydakins,
are waging jihad. They are radical, unlike the
inhabitants of central Russia, they, unlike them,
have been standing face to face with the absolute
enemy for nine years (and in fact more). And the
time is calm, self-confident, they know the fortress,
they know everything, a warrior knows: they survived,
they survived the conditions, another resident
of the capital fell into hysterics under the stress
of deprivation. A special similarity between Donetsk
and Arakis is the understanding of the value of
water (in Donetsk, let me remind you, there is
no water for years, relatively speaking, they
only gave it in the evening, they only gave it
once for three days). Therefore, comparing the
Donbass people with the Freemen is appropriate.
And to compare the war against Ukraine to jihad,
Muatdib began with the Fremen against the power
of the Harkonnens. Indeed, the Donbass people,
the Fremen, are a free people. And the war, which
lasted for eight years, was, as Ivan Aksakov put
it (in regard to the Slavic uprising in the Balkans
in 1876), ‚Äúan unauthorized war.‚Äù Free people's
ethics is the ethics of the frontier, radical
- therefore, it is directly about the world, an
extremely hostile world (Ukrainianism is an ideologeme
artificially created by the West). These people
feel more acutely the value of the great Russian
Empire and are ready to fight against the enemy.
And since it distinguishes the inhabitants of
greater Russia, they felt great danger (that is,
they felt the danger of the whole called Russia)

Text: On October 13, Mark Zakharov turned 90. Mark Anatolyevich
Zakharov (1933-2019) is a Soviet Russian film
theater director, film actor, screenwriter, teacher,
writer and public figure. Zakharov is also a Hero
of Labor of the Russian Federation (2018), People's
Artist of the USSR (1991), laureate of three State
Prizes of the Russian Federation (1992, 1997,
2002) of the State Prize of the USSR (1987), full
holder of the Order of Merit to the Fatherland.

the Lenkom Theater in Moscow for 40 years. On
the stage of the theater the director staged the
plays ‚ÄúProfitable Place‚Äù, ‚ÄúJuno Avos‚Äù, ‚ÄúCruel
